After more than 3 months of movement requesting for freedom and real democracy, the people of Hong Kong are anticipating the election of District Council on 24th of November with high expectation.

Hong Kong has no real universal suffrage now and the government deny the people any kind of referendum. Elections of the District Council and the Legislative Council are highly valued by the people, even though the elections are considered unfair and biased.

However, the government threatened on 27th September that she may stop the election, if any events considered as “not in order” happen on or near the election day. Once again the government tries to silent the voice of Hong Kong people by way of a totalitarian tyranny.

There are no reasons for the people of Hong Kong to upset the District Council election. In fact, all the pro-democracy parties are trying their best to win the election against pro-Beijing parties, in order to reflect the true voice of the people.

We urge the international society to monitor closely the situation in Hong Kong, especially events that are relate to or may affect the 24th November election. A fair and proper election is one of the ways that Hong Kong may get out of the current turmoil, which was started by the push of the unwelcome extradition bill amendment by the government.

Hong Kong has no real universal suffrage now and the government deny the people any kind of referendum. Elections of the District Council and the Legislative Council are highly valued by the people, even though the elections are considered unfair and biased.

However, the government threatened on 27th September that she may stop the election, if any events considered as “not in order” happen on or near the election day. Once again the government tries to silent the voice of Hong Kong people by way of a totalitarian tyranny.

There are no reasons for the people of Hong Kong to upset the District Council election. In fact, all the pro-democracy parties are trying their best to win the election against pro-Beijing parties, in order to reflect the true voice of the people.

We urge the international society to monitor closely the situation in Hong Kong, especially events that are relate to or may affect the 24th November election. A fair and proper election is one of the ways that Hong Kong may get out of the current turmoil, which was started by the push of the unwelcome extradition bill amendment by the government.

quote.msg:
After more than 3 months of movement requesting for freedom and real democracy, the people of Hong Kong are anticipating the election of District Council on 24th of November with high expectation.

Hong Kong has no real universal suffrage now and the government deny the people any kind of referendum. Elections of the District Council and the Legislative Council are highly valued by the people, even though the elections are considered unfair and biased.

However, the government threatened on 27th September that she may stop the election, if any events considered as “not in order” happen on or near the election day. Once again the government tries to silent the voice of Hong Kong people by way of a totalitarian tyranny.

There are no reasons for the people of Hong Kong to upset the District Council election. In fact, all the pro-democracy parties are trying their best to win the election against pro-Beijing parties, in order to reflect the true voice of the people.

We urge the international society to monitor closely the situation in Hong Kong, especially events that are relate to or may affect the 24th November election. A fair and proper election is one of the ways that Hong Kong may get out of the current turmoil, which was started by the push of the unwelcome extradition bill amendment by the government.

However, the government threatened on 27th September that she may stop the election, if any events considered as “not in order” happen on or near the election day. Once again the government tries to silent the voice of Hong Kong people by way of a totalitarian tyranny.

There are no reasons for the people of Hong Kong to upset the District Council election. In fact, all the pro-democracy parties are trying their best to win the election against pro-Beijing parties, in order to reflect the true voice of the people.

We urge the international society to monitor closely the situation in Hong Kong, especially events that are relate to or may affect the 24th November election. A fair and proper election is one of the ways that Hong Kong may get out of the current turmoil, which was started by the push of the unwelcome extradition bill amendment by the government.
